channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Green telecomms cabinet near 82, South Eden Park Rd, Eden Park, Beckenham - nr jct with Hawksbrook Lane - spray tag., 13th November
item.description:
Green telecomms cabinet near 82, South Eden Park Rd, Eden Park, Beckenham - nr jct with Hawksbrook Lane - spray tag. Seen Wed 12/11/25 I'm doing this report from memory hours after seeing it from a moving vehicle and I think this is the location. Otherwise it is the other side of the metal rail bridge by 64 South Eden Park Rd, also on a cabinet.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 79, South Eden Park Road, Eden Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Building with overly bright poorly directed flood light, 13th November
item.description:
This school has several extremely bright and poorly directed flood lights on constantly throughout the night, every single night. You can see surrounding buildings all lid up in slightly white blue tone, due to these light from this building.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Egerton Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Egerton Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Dumped sofa along Churchill Walk, 12th November
item.description:
Sofa dumped along Churchill Walk, at the end of a block I think between Tresham Walk and Dean Close but I might be one block off. It is completely obvious. The sofa and all the cushions were dumped there weeks ago and have not been removed. Very unsightly
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dean Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken door and broken fence along brook path, 12th November
item.description:
There used to be a door to this path and it has been broken for a year or so. The fences have also broke. I’ve seen curious secondary school children wandering into that path and there is a risk of falling into the brook. For public safety, I think the door and fence should be fixed like the one on cromwell road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hampden Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet
